content.description: Climb a series of small roofs 15ft to the right of Velcro Gloves.  Pull through the roof to varied slab, face, and overhanging moves.
content.protection: TR Anchors on the top of the feature.  Bring cord.

content.description:
A. 5.6 R/X Lead up a mossy crack easy 5.5 climbing reach your first piece at 25-30ft.  Traverse right 20 ft.  Head up the dihedral with good gear pull an easy roof top-out and find many bueno belay stances. 

  B. 5.6 PG13 (Direct) Start on a block ten feet to the left of the dihedral.  Climb the right leaning flared crack past a bolt then make for gear in the dihedral and follow it up to rap anchors.
content.location: Located up the gully you go through to access the second tier of Sport Wall.  Go up 300ft on the South side of the gully.

climbs.name: Tres Amigos
climbs.fa: Michelle Locatelli/ Richard and Lisa Harrison

content.description: This was an existing top-rope route that we bolted and did the first free ascent of. Bouldery start and then on up an overhanging face. Really fun route. What a view!
content.location: Route is located on  Lower Sport Wall. It's the middle of 3 bolted routes on obvious prow, that start off rock platform at end of trail.

content.description: P1: Climb the slightly overhanging off-width to a block good gear solid stacks and a knee-bar.  Pull the lip belay on a big ledge.  P2: Walk ten feet behind a boulder into a side leaning chimney.  Chimney up 10ft to a ledge belay off the ledge. Thin and fun slab climbing up to a belay stance with a nice horn to sling.
content.protection: P1: Gear to a #5 and doubles of #3s would be nice.   P2: The smallest nuts and cams you have. Brassies or micro-stoppers would help.
content.location: Hike all the way up to the top of the Sport Wall gully.  Go past a the old power plant debris looking for a series of large chimneys at the top of the hill.  The route starts out on the right side of the largest gully on the wall.

content.description: P1: Climb the squeeze chimney up to a ledge.  BEWARE!!   the block at the top of the chimney that you want to use to exit the chimney is loose go hard right.    P2: Traverse around a bulge level with the belay get a couple of ok nuts continue up towards a fin.  Good gear when you hit the crack.  Pull the fin an continue up to a belay stance behind a tine pine tree.
content.protection: Gear to a #4 friend (A 5 could be placed on the second pitch but isn't necessary.)
content.location: Up the same gully as Throwing Rocks at Goats  right side of the desenct gully under the largest chimney.

content.description: Climb the snaking crack to a ledge easy 4th class to a nice belay stance.
content.location: Located halfway between the Sport Rocks Turnout and the second tier of Sport Wall. On the uphill side of the trail.  Easy walk off.
